description: Rapidly promoted through a series of increasingly responsible positions; direct report to the Senior Vice President. Provided managerial oversight to 120-member team, with 12 direct reports. Controlled $120M+ division revenue backlog. Directed all new business development efforts and set division goals and targets. Built and maintained strong customer relationships. Successfully resolved numerous programs that had fallen behind schedule and gone over budget. Owned all Intelligence Avionic Solutions (IAS) programs, including avionics and flight safety, tactical radios, and Signals Intelligence (SIGINT).

description: Served as Project Director and liaised between production facility in Michigan and integration facility in California. Communicated and resolved all issues between Boeing and GE Aerospace. Reviewed and managed all Systems requirements with Boeing vs. Smiths Aerospace. Developed all system and system integration schedules for the C-130-AMP upgrade program. Managed the DO-178B level certification teams for the Smiths Flight Management Systems. Developed a common Datalink plan for the USCG.

description: Led coast guard radiation emissions testing and upgrade program for 60 airplanes. Developed five-year avionics roadmap and upgrade plan. Determined program needs, procured and allocated resources, and managed vendor relationships. Served as primary point of contact between D.C. headquarters, subcontractors, and the USCG Commander. Successfully created standardized avionics upgrade path through effective cross-platform program management; impacted the C-130H, C-130J, HH-60, HH-65, and the HU-25. Developed and standardized installation procedures for no-standard Aircraft equipment. Developed Aircraft EMI testing procedures for all non-standard aircraft equipment installations. Developed a common Datalink plan for the USCG. Successfully created standardized avionics upgrade path through effective cross-platform program management; impacted the C-130H, C-130J, HH-60, HH-65, and the HU-25.

description: Led up to 100-member global teams in executing numerous programs, including retrofit programs, throughout Asia, Europe, and the U.S., with budget responsibility in excess of $12M. Provided critical sales support and worked closely with the division President. Designed and developed new DSP modem software and interpreter control software for Datalink, voice communications, and GPS navigation applications. Developed DO-178B certified 1553 interface for commercial Aircraft. Managed the DO-178B level certification team for Collins Flight Management Systems. Worked several Do-178B Flight Management development programs from initial concept to completion. Key member of team that designed company’s ARN-118 digital tactical air navigation system (TACAN) replacement. Designed the digital receiver for Collins digital replacement for the ARN-118 to TNC-250.
